The TWO OF THEM STAND FACE TO FACE for the first time. A frozen moment of terror. Suddenly: BOTH SCREAM. And run away in opposite directions. ANGLE ON EACH, running away, screaming. The astronaut's screams are muffled inside his helmet. Each knocks over things in a panic to get away. What they don't realize is that the room is round and the fleeing is leading them right into... Each other. SMASH, they crash into each other and both fa Each sits up. Each screams. They run away. The astronaut winds up falling into a tang of mobile wires and stuck in the air, as if floating in space. Lem keeps running until he realizes he's not being chased He turns and looks back. He sees the astronaut struggling to get free. Suddenly, on the astronaut's spacesuit, the hose gets cau on a wire and is pulled out. SOUND OF AIR HISSING. ON THE ASTRONAUT, realizing he's in trouble. He checks hi oxygen gauge: It's quickly draining. Now the astronaut panics, terrified. ON LEM, seeing how scared he is. He feels bad for it. He notices the wires and follows them to where they're held a hook in the wall. Lem gets an idea, one that's going t take some courage. He takes a breath and crosses to the hook. He looks back the astronaut.

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: Wish I had that cork. Taking a brave step, he unhooks the wires. The mobile wir - and astronaut - come crashing down. The astronaut scrambles to his feet and looks at the gaug IT READS EMPTY. Freaked, choking, he looks all around. He has no choice. undoes the metal lock around his helmet. He turns to the side and slowly pulls off his helmet. We the face of: CAPTAIN CHARLES (CHUCK) BAKER, mid-30's, handsome. His cheeks are puffed as he holds his breath. Finally, he let it out and takes a scary breath. To his surprise, it's ok He takes another.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: I can breathe! I can breathe!! Remembering Lem, he turns and they face each other. A pau

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: You speak my language.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: That's amazing! You speak my language.

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: That's what I just said.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: (self-satisfied) You just said, "That's what I just said." Say something else!

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: Like what?

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: "Like - what"! They're gonna freak back at Kennedy!  They circle each other a bit, staring. Chuck points to himself.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm Captain Charles T. Baker. Astronaut. As-tro-naut.

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: Ass...

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: «.-Tronaut!

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: (points to himself) Lem. Lem. Lem.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: You name is either Lem. Or Lem, Lem, Lem.

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: Thanks for asking. Coffee light, two sugars, some kind of a puff pastry...

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: I mean... are you here to take over our world and... eat our brains?

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: Whoa, what kind of sick planet is this? First of all, none of you are supposed to be here! The profile said uninhabited! My mission was to plant old glory, whack some golf balls and head on back for my guest spot on Oprah. (stops, off Lem's confused face) What?

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: "Op-rah..." You were just talking alien.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: I'm not the alien here, you are.

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: You are.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: No, you are.

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: You are. You came to my planet.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: An alien planet! Heeellloooo!

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: (greeting) Hello...

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: Not hello! Heeeelllooooooo!

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: What? A pause. Chuck takes a moment to catch his breath.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let's start over. SOUND of a SIREN from outside. Chuck checks the nearby window and sees police cars on patrol.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Look, I've got alien Sheriff Andy on my tail and I need to get back to my ship. My command module's in orbit and if I don't return in... (checks digital readout) .-.-74 hours it goes back to earth without me. Capish? I need your help.

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: You want me to take you to your flying saucer? (considers) I don't know. I could get in trouble. I just kind of got my future on track...

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: Opie, you're my only shot. Of course you could leave me stranded.  I 'spose my wife can get a job to support our kids. Eleven of them. Better they grow up without a father than you get in a little bit of trouble. Lem sighs.

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: Okay, I'll take you there, but then you're on your own! Lem heads for the door. Chuck lingers, then follows.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: Lem my man! Five on high! Don't leave me hanging. cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the hill leading to the planetarium. Rover comes chugging slowly up, tired. Suddenly, a car approaches com the other way. Rover ducks. WE SEE LEM drives the car with Chuck in the backseat. With the car gone, Rover continues to roll on. But he sto and turns, his tracking device now points the other way. Rover heaves a tired SIGH, turns and follows the car, onl at his own, much slower pace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lem drives - reaching main street. Chuck keeps low in the backseat, but looks at the alien town in amazement. His helmet and suit are with him.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: I don't get it. Planet One was supposed to be uninhabited.

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: (confused) What's Planet One?

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: I took the liberty of naming your world. (kind of artsy)  Planet One 'cause it's my first landing. Catchy, don'cha think? cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Onlookers stand behind police lines. The TV reporter is i make-up, a napkin over his shirt. The ship is guarded by half a dozen police including Chief Gorloc. Lem drives up.

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: There it is. MOVE IN ON CHUCK looking around. He's decisive, like a he

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: (decides) Okay, here's the plan. You knock out that cop. Then, you overpower those two. You neutralize that one and handcuff the big guy to the steering wheel.

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: What about you?

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: I can't be seen breaking the law. I'm a role model on account of having the Right Stuff.

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: The what?

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: Right Stuff. Means I have a lot of courage. (ducks back cowardly) Now go. Lem hesitates. Chuck manages to slip the door open and pushes Lem out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Go, go, go. OUTSIDE THE CAR, Lem looks around awkwardly. The nearest has his back to Lem. Lem looks to Chuck who signals with judo chop for Lem to knock him out. Lem instinctively bac away from Chuck, bumping into the cop who turns. REVEAL Chief Gorloc.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF GORLOC
dialogues.text: Lem? Something wrong? Lem looks at Chuck who motions with a judo chop. Lem smil at the Chief uneasily. The moment is interrupted by a rumbling as: The army pulls up. Jeeps, tanks, trucks. Soldiers fan out The whole place is quickly surrounded. The TV reporter and crew snap into action, turning to fil the army. In Lem's car, Chuck sinks even lower to stay hidden.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: Oh boy... ANGLE ON THE SOLDIERS, standing back, jumping to attentio Someone is coming, someone very very important. ANGLE BEHIND that someone, as he walks through the row of soldiers. This is GENERAL GRAWL. Towering, mighty. Even f behind he's perfect, every hair of his crewcut in place, uniform sharp and crisp. His walk resonates authority. Grawl suddenly stops at one soldier. ANGLE ON THAT SOLDIER, not moving, but registering terror What's he done wrong? His eyes drift down over his unifor to... .»-- horror of horrors, an errant thread on his jacket. H eyes go wide. Finally we REVEAL the face of General Grawl. There's noth about him that isn't perfectly in place. He's handsome an stern, Burt Lancaster with antenna.

dialogues.speaker: GRAWL
dialogues.text: Do you know why we call ita uniform, son? The terrified soldier shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: GRAWL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Because when we're all uniform, then we can see who the enemy is. The soldier nervously reaches down and pulls off the thr A killer pause. Grawl walks up to the CAPTAIN to get his first look at the ship.

dialogues.speaker: GRAWL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Captain, have your men search the flying saucer. The Captain salutes and motions to soldiers in radiation suits who approach the ship. Others ready their rifles to back them up. ON CHUCK, not liking this. ON LEM, trying to get back to the car, finding soldiers i his way. He stops and forces a smile. ON THE SHIP as the soldiers exit with armfuls of stuff: N food, moose hair product, Vanity Fair magazine, etc. Ther also an MP3 player. A soldier drops the MP3 player. It starts to play "Space Oddity" by David Bowie. They all run for cover. A horrified pause.

dialogues.speaker: SONG
dialogues.text: "Ground Control to Major Tom your circuit's dead, there's something wrong! Can you hear me Major Tom?" Suddenly, three shots are fired, killing the player. REVEAL GRAWL fired the shots.

dialogues.speaker: GRAWL
dialogues.text: This is worse than I thought.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: The music, Sir?

dialogues.speaker: GRAWL
dialogues.text: That's no music I ever heard! It must be some sort of alien mind- control! Seal off the town! I want that alien pilot found! From the onlookers, a voice.

dialogues.speaker: A VOICE
dialogues.text: I protest! REVEAL the voice belongs to Glar. Flanked by the Teens a Neera, he steps up and gives his guitar a STRUM.

dialogues.speaker: GLAR
dialogues.text: Daddeo, you're bumming me out with those negative vibrations! A pause. They look at Glar blankly.

dialogues.speaker: GRAWL
dialogues.text: Never mind, Captain, the alien's right here. Soldiers grab Glar's arms. Neera steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: NEERA
dialogues.text: Glar's not the alien!

dialogues.speaker: GRAWL
dialogues.text: Oh no??? Then what do you call this?! Grawl holds Glar's long hair.

dialogues.speaker: NEERA
dialogues.text: Hair! He likes it long!

dialogues.speaker: GRAWL
dialogues.text: Very unusual. You might even say - very alien!! The Teacher, watching nearby, speaks up.

dialogues.speaker: TEACHER
dialogues.text: Uh, General, he does go to the high school. That stops Grawl.

dialogues.speaker: NEERA
dialogues.text: Glar's just trying to say the aliens might be friendly. (sees Lem) Lem, you know astronomy. If an alien came all this way wouldn't it be smart enough to come in peace? Lem is about to answer when he notices a soldier peering his car, another reaching for the door. He rushes over:

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: Not!!! He stands between the soldier and the door. He looks aro realizes he's acting suspicious and tries to cover.

dialogues.speaker: LEM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I mean... They're everywhere! They want our brains with hot sauce! We should all go home and hide! Eckle - standing nearby - happens to look inside and catc glimpse of Chuck. His eyes go wide. Lem gets in the car.

dialogues.speaker: GRAWL
dialogues.text: That's a sensible young man. (to soldiers) Let him go. (to bystanders) And the rest of you, go to your homes and wait for instructions. The soldiers let Lem drive past. People start disbanding. Passing Neera, Lem sees the look on her face. She's disgusted by what he just said. Lem feels horrible, but w all the soldiers there he has to drive away. He pulls the car into his garage. cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door open, we see Lem sneaking Chuck upstairs and int the room. As they enter, Lem goes about shutting the shad

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: Great! Just great!

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: This is a disaster!

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: A TOTAL disaster!

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: It couldn't have gone worse!

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: You can say that again!

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: That look on Neera's face!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (look at him askew) Who's disaster are we talking about?

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: (continuing) And I have the alien in my room! If someone finds you here...

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: Hello, stranded astronaut in the house! Let's keep our eye on the prize, kid! (points to watch) The clock's ticking and I gotta get back up there! Suddenly, a knock at door. The door starts to open. It's Lem's Mom. Lem struggles to keep it from opening all the way.

dialogues.speaker: LEM'S MOM
dialogues.text: Lem, who's that talking?

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: Just the TV!

dialogues.speaker: LEM'S MOM
dialogues.text: Well turn it off and come down to dinner. Lem pushes against the door.

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: Not hungry!

dialogues.speaker: LEM'S MOM
dialogues.text: Who is, with that disgusting alien running around, but you need your nutrition.

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: Okay, be right down! Lem's Mom goes and he closes the door with a sigh of reli From behind Lem...

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: Disgusting?! Did you tell her I'm People Magazine's 37th sexiest man?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to go or she'll come back. As Lem leaves:

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: Well what am I supposed to do? The door closes. Chuck turns and sees himself in a full- length mirror.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (muses ) It's the suit that makes me look fat. cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Army trucks go by. Pause. Rover peers around the corner. Suddenly, a rock lands next to him. Rover stops, picks it up, examines it and grows excited. Happy, he stores it in his compartment. Then, another rock lands by him. Rover looks up and aroun Then, all at once a handful of rocks comes down. Rover ra to catch them all, excited as can be. WE FINALLY REVEAL SKIFF, coming out of a hole dug in his yard. He's been digging an air raid shelter. Skiff carries a huge rock, too big to be thrown from belo Just as he's ready to toss it, Skiff sees Rover staring a him. Skiff recoils. Rover eyes the rock. He really wants it. He approaches Skiff.

dialogues.speaker: SKIFF
dialogues.text: Don't probe me! There's nothing up there you wanna see! But Rover comes closer. Skiff panics. He winds up and tos the rock at him. Rover catches it and dances with excitement. He holds it examines it, savors it and finally stores it in his inner compartment. He looks back at Skiff lovingly, grateful. Skiff realizes he's next. Horrified, expecting the worst runs off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skiff enters and closes the door behind him. We don't see where he is yet. He runs right up to camera a la the end "Invasion of the Body Snatchers". He shouts:

dialogues.speaker: SKIFF
dialogues.text: They're here! They're here now!! Can't you see?!! You're next!! (right to camera)

dialogues.speaker: YOU'RE NEXT
dialogues.text: REVEAL he's inside... THE LOCAL BOWLING ALLEY. Only a couple of people bowl. Th rest are watching invasion news on the TV. No one pays hi any attention. ANGLE ON THE DOOR as Rover enters. He's low to the ground no one else notices him. He stops when he sees rack after rack filled with bowling balls. So many rocks! He dances with glee and turns to Skiff with love. Skiff backs up in fear. Suddenly, a woman sees Rover and SCREAMS. Quickly, the wh place is in a panic as people bolt for the doors. Soldiers enter. Rover sees and quickly races away and hid behind a curtain. Turns out he's hiding inside the photo booth, shaking in fear. He sneaks a peak at the incoming soldiers through t curtain and doing so accidentally turns on the machine an gets 4 pictures taken. The way he looks at the flashing light of the photo booth, it almost seems like he's posin for them. That draws the attention of the soldiers. They surround t booth. Suddenly Rover bursts out. The soldiers chase, shooting. Rover ducks behind a rack of balls, tossing it over to ma the soldiers scatter. Now Rover is making a dash down the lanes, dodging bullet heading for the pins. A small PIECE of him is shot off an falls on the lane. SMASH, he gets a strike. The soldiers go after him, but can't find him in the mes pins. Where did he go? END ON SKIFF, watching the whole thing, amazed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rover makes it out the back door. Safe for now, he looks around. He heads off toward's Lem's neighborhood. cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEAL CHUCK'S OUTER SPACE SUIT on the couch. He's taken off and wears his jumpsuit. He settles back, watching TV. ON TV: Planet One's "Lassie", showing a monstrous alien d and his OWNER.

dialogues.speaker: OWNER
dialogues.text: What is it, Apgar? Is Glack in trouble? The dog barks 'yes' in its alien way. Chuck turns the channel. ON TV: A VARIETY SHOW with choru girls doing a dance number around a Sinatra-esque crooner Chuck turns the channel. ON TV: Planet One's "I Love Lucy The HUSBAND scolds the WIFE.

dialogues.speaker: HUSBAND
dialogues.text: Maglog, we can't afford that hat!

dialogues.speaker: WIFE
dialogues.text: (Lucy-like sound) Wuaaaahhhhhnnnn!!! Chuck turns the channel. From barking Apgar, to dancing girls, to crying Maglog. Around and around. Chuck leans forward. He's having a realization a la the Statue of Liberty moment in "Planet of the Apes".

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: No... No... It can't be... BIG MOVE IN TO CHUCK as he dramatically realizes:

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm on a planet with 3 channels! Lem enters the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: You can't stay here. You gotta go. Chuck rises, ready for action.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: Couldn't agree more! What's the plan?

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: The plan is you get out of my life! I said I'd take you to your ship. Well, there it is. Lem opens the shade to reveal the ship. There's double th number of soldiers around, spotlights on the ship, search lights on the sky. It's like his house has been placed in the middle of a sci fi thriller. Lem closes the shade, discouraged. He heads off:

dialogues.speaker: LEM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'll get you a blanket and pillow. Chuck peaks out through the blinds.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: (half to himself) It's a miracle I'm gonna need...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the throng of soldiers, CAMERA MOVES below to find... ROVER, hiding under an army truck. He looks around and fi his opportunity. He quickly rolls to the front of Lem's house. He tries to get in, but it's locked. Looking aroun furtively, he rolls behind some bushes to wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lem is making up Chuck's bed as Chuck brushes his teeth w some weird alien toothpaste. The TV is on in background.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: I know! Get me to your space program!

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: We don't have a space program.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: Really? By our 50's we were launching rockets to explore what's up there.

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: We already know what's up there. Nothing. Chuck is about to counter, when, from the TV:

dialogues.speaker: TV ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: We interrupt our regular programming for this public service announcement.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: These are always so boring. Chuck's about to turn it off when, ON TV, comes a TITLE:

dialogues.speaker: 50'S ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: "What To Do When Aliens Invade"!! This is a grainy, black and white instructional film. The SHOW DISSOLVES TO A CLASSROOM. Students approach the teacher.

dialogues.speaker: STUDENT 1
dialogues.text: Hey Professor Kipple. What's all this guff about aliens? ON TV, REVEAL THE TEACHER, PROFESSOR KIPPLE. Bald and sho Though he's normally weird and perverted, he's acting lik the perfect 50's authority figure here.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR KIPPLE
dialogues.text: Why Gippy, aliens aren't so scary, once you understand them. Hit the lights. ON TV, Kipple throws a switch for a projector. Up comes a CRUDELY ANIMATED 50ish version of aliens.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR KIPPLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Aliens are a lot like us, except for their hypodermic fingertips,  spare set of teeth and beaks for sucking brains out of their victim's heads. ANGLE ON LEM, looking at Chuck suspiciously.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: What...? Lem looks back at the TV. ON TV, crude animation of pods a la ‘Invasion of the Body Snatchers'.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR KIPPLE
dialogues.text: Aliens can replicate our bodies, using an advanced technology called pods. And their huge brains have the power to turn us into zombies. Kipple is cut off as Lem turns off the TV. He crawls into his bed.

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: I'm harboring the most wanted fugitive in the world! Yesterday my life was all set. Now - my whole world is upside down. Chuck settles into his bed and looks up.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: At least you have a world. (realizing) I'll probably never see mine again. From HIGH ANGLE, PULL BACK on Chuck looking up, higher an higher to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: «+. until we find Chuck's command module. We keep moving THROUGH A WINDOW and inside the craft until we come to: THE DIGITAL READOUT, linked to the one that Chuck has on suit. It's counting down the time left for Chuck to dock with his ship. About 2 days and 7 hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We establish the paranoia. People on the street staring at each other in mistrust; a storekeeper who's frightened and locking his door; people afraid to meet each others' eyes. The mail truck pulls up next to a milk truck. The Mailman and Milkman get out and cross paths warily.

dialogues.speaker: MAILMAN
dialogues.text: Hello "Plark", if that's really you.

dialogues.speaker: MILKMAN
dialogues.text: Have a nice day, "Serbok". Or should I call you by your alien name? NEARBY a MOM pulls her boy by the arm.

dialogues.speaker: BOY
dialogues.text: I don't wanna go to school! They come upon two soldiers.

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER 3
dialogues.text: What's the trouble here?

dialogues.speaker: BOY
dialogues.text: (thinking fast) My mom's an alien replicant!

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER 3
dialogues.text: Grab her! The Mom SCREAMS and runs from the soldiers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A paperboy rides his alien bike through the bright suburb streets. He tosses newspapers as he goes, past the soldie bivouacked on the suburban lawns. Finally passing Lem's house, he throws the paper. We FOLLOW THE PAPER as it hits the front door and lands o the front step. Suddenly Rover's arm reaches over from th nearby bushes and snatches it. ANGLE BEHIND THE BUSHES REVEALS ROVER, holding the paper ducking. ON THE FRONT DOOR as Lem's Dad steps out. No paper. Leavi the door open, he walks onto the walkway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) That's funny, where's the paper? When he turns back, he sees the newspaper is sitting on t front step. ANGLE BEHIND BUSHES shows Rover is no longer there, presumably inside the house now. ANGLE NEARBY as soldiers snap to extreme attention. Up wa General Grawl. IN THE BACKGROUND, soldiers keep working around the ship. Some in radiation suits examine the planted American Flag with their version of Geiger Counters. Grawl reaches the Captain.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: No trace of the alien, sir.

dialogues.speaker: GRAWL
dialogues.text: How can something so different hide in all this beautiful sameness?

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR KIPPLE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I can answer that, General. Through the throng of soldiers, Professor Kipple approach They step back. All know and respect him.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR KIPPLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: By using its enormous brain to control our thoughts. Even YOU could be an alien zombie and not know it.

dialogues.speaker: GRAWL
dialogues.text: Good point, Professor. (to Captain, offers sidearm) Captain, place me under arrest!

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR KIPPLE
dialogues.text: No need for that. But we can't be sure of anything. For all we know that flag could be a doomsday device. Pull it out of the ground, our whole world could vaporize! ANGLE ON THE FLAG. The soldiers with Geiger Counters have found it clean and backed away as another soldier has jus  begun to pull it out of the ground. Hearing Kipple, he stops. The soldier smiles uneasily and furtively slips the flag back.

dialogues.speaker: GRAWL
dialogues.text: What do we do? ON KIPPLE, this is what he's been leading up to.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR KIPPLE
dialogues.text: Capture the alien - alive - and bring it to me. (hungrily) I will unlock the secrets of its brain! Grawl's hand reaches in, offering a handkerchief.

dialogues.speaker: GRAWL
dialogues.text: Here, Professor, you were drooling. A jeep drives up and screeches to a halt in front the General. A soldier jumps out and salutes.

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER
dialogues.text: We detained the witnesses at the bowling alley. And we found this. He hands Grawl the PHOTO BOOTH PICTURES OF ROVER. Grawl a Kipple exchange a look.

dialogues.speaker: GRAWL
dialogues.text: Captain, go door to door, but find that alien! Professor. Grawl heads off. Kipple follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lem and Chuck are sleeping, Chuck like a kid with his but in the air. Suddenly, a loud KNOCK. Both bolt awake. The door starts to open. Lem dashes to block it.

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: Mom, don't come in! He tries to close it, but something's wedging it open. H looks down to see a tire in the way. Confused, he opens t door a bit more to find: ROVER, looking up at Lem. Lem backs up, terrified. Rover enters and heads to Chuck. His beeping speeds up and indicates he's reached his destination. Chuck sees the tracking light on his own sui and realizes:

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: Rover? Boy am I glad to see you! Chuck pets him on the head like a dog.

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: Rover? As Chuck speaks, Lem shuts the door.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: He's a probe we sent to take pictures. (realizes, scolds Rover) A planet full of aliens and you send back pictures of rocks??? Bad boy! Bad Rover! Rover hangs his head and whines. Suddenly, a knock at the door. Lem rushes over.

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: Mom, don't come in! But he's not in time and the door opens. It's Eckle who s Chuck and lights up.

dialogues.speaker: ECKLE
dialogues.text: I knew it! I knew it! You're the alien! This is so neat!!! Can I get your autograph?? Lem start drags Eckle to the door.

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: Eckle, this isn't a comic book, it's serious! Chuck finds a pen and steps over, playing the reluctant celeb.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: I don't mind. Comes with being a national hero. Here ya go, son. Chuck signs Eckle's comic book. Then notices Eckle's came

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How about a snapshot?

dialogues.speaker: ECKLE
dialogues.text: Yeah! Chuck poses mightily. Eckle takes a picture.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: Wait, I can do better, gimme a moment. Chuck composes himself like an actor and poses more mightily. Eckle takes another picture.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Get one of me looking up at the stars. A QUICK SUCCESSION OF SHOTS: Chuck looking up like an Apo astronaut; Chuck giving a thumbs up; a cheesecake pose; a brooding headshot pose; touching Lem's finger a la Michelangelo's Creation of Adam. Suddenly a KNOCK at the door. Chuck and Lem exchange a panicked look.

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: But the door opens. Skiff enters blabbing.

dialogues.speaker: SKIFF
dialogues.text: I saw the alien! He has giant claws and an evil red eye! He tried to put me in his spell, but I just looked him right in the eye and... Suddenly sees Rover and Chuck. Rover rushes up affectionately and rubs Skiff's leg. Skiff faints. They all gather around him. Lem tries to shake him awake.

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: Skiff? Skiff? Skiff looks up. He sees Lem, then Rover, then Chuck. He recoils in fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aliens!!! Lem run, I'll hold them off! (aside) Unless you wanna hold them off...

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: Skiff, they're friendly, trust me. Skiff looks at Lem and realizes something horrifying. He backs up.

dialogues.speaker: SKIFF
dialogues.text: You're not Lem! You're a replicant! (pinches Lem) Such an obvious fake! What've you done with Lem?!!

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: (eyes windows nervously) You gotta keep it down! Rover sidles up to Skiff and nuzzles him. Skiff is scared first, but he stops and looks at Rover's cute face. Rover one eye blinks so adorably as he tilts his head like a do Skiff melts.

dialogues.speaker: SKIFF
dialogues.text: It's kinda cute the way he does that. Lem jumps on the opportunity to calm Skiff down.

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: Look at his face. Is that the face of evil?

dialogues.speaker: SKIFF
dialogues.text: (softening) I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: Of course not. They need our help. They just wanna go home. Skiff slowly reaches out and pets Rover. Rover sidles up affectionately.

dialogues.speaker: SKIFF
dialogues.text: (delighted) Look, he likes me! Suddenly, another knock at the door. Lem has had it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great, let's just have a party! Lem opens the door and finds himself staring at: TWO SOLDIERS.

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER 1
dialogues.text: Just doing a routine search for the alien... Suddenly, they see Chuck and aim their files, fumbling, nervous. They enter.

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER 1, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Whatta we do?!

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER 2
dialogues.text: I dunno!!

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER 1
dialogues.text: Don't look at his eyes! That's how they take over your mind! Lem gets an idea.

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: That's right! Resistance is futile! Lem clears his throat and gives Chuck a pointed look.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: Right. Futile. Check. Chuck holds his arms outstretched and approaches the soldiers, making a high-pitched sci-fi HUMMING SOUND.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ammmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmm .

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER 2
dialogues.text: What's it doing?! Lem holds his head in mock fear.

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: He's taking over our brains!! Chuck stops a moment. What's wrong with Lem? He realizes is playing along and keeps HUMMING. Chuck reaches out and puts a hand on each of the soldier heads. He speaks like Spock. The MUSIC becomes Star Trek- like.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: Our minds are melding. Our minds are one! Repeat after me. I-am- Spock! The soldiers exchange a confused look, but obey.

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIERS
dialogues.text: I-am-Spock! From across the room.

dialogues.speaker: SKIFF
dialogues.text: I-am-Spock! Skiff approaches Chuck like a zombie. Lem holds him back.

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: (aside to Skiff) It's not real.

dialogues.speaker: SKIFF
dialogues.text: (haughty) I think I know when I'm being mind- controlled.

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER 1
dialogues.text: It's inside my head!!

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER 2
dialogues.text: His will is too strong!

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER 1
dialogues.text: Command us, Master!

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: Hold that thought. Chuck pulls Lem aside, near the window.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Maybe they can get me on my ship. Lem looks outside. The place is swarming with soldiers.

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: Too many soldiers.  Then, Lem spots the TV crew outside. A lightbulb moment.

dialogues.speaker: LEM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But I have another idea. You're gonna talk to the world and tell them your friendly. But first we gotta get you out of here. Lem spots the mind-controlled soldiers and realizes how.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens automatically, revealing an army jeep. The mind-controlled soldiers are in the front seat, Lem and Skiff in the backseat, Chuck and Rover hidden under the backseat. As the jeep starts up, Eckle climbs in.

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: Go home, Eckle! But Chuck reaches out and positions Eckle as a shield to hide behind.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: You kiddin'? Plenty of room. (to soldiers) Let's go. The jeep slowly pulls out past many soldiers who have to step out of the way. Very tense. Finally, they pass the soldiers and takes off. cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glar stands out front with Neera and some ordinary teens.

dialogues.speaker: TEEN 1
dialogues.text: Whatta you mean 'protest'?

dialogues.speaker: GLAR
dialogues.text: We need a slogan. Something that says it's a bummer to make war on the aliens when we should make... Glar can't quite think of how to finish the sentence.

dialogues.speaker: NEERA
dialogues.text: Love? Make love, not war...? MOVE IN ON GLAR, considering. Is this the beginning of a movement?

dialogues.speaker: GLAR
dialogues.text: Nah, that's not it. ANGLE ON the jeep driving by. Lem looks out and sees Neer He smiles and waves. But she looks at him angrily. Lem lo at the soldiers and moans to Skiff:

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: Great, now she thinks I'm hunting the alien! Lem is mortified as the jeep drives on. cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lem and the others enter from the back door. This is a ge paradise, with full-sized sci-fi monster cut-outs, movie posters, props, etc. Skiff is freaked to have everyone in the store.

dialogues.speaker: SKIFF
dialogues.text: Why does he have to be here? Lem sits, discouraged. Chuck absently picks up a comic bo

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: It's just 'till we get him on TV.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: You really think you can?

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: You're the biggest story in history. The whole planet'1ll watch.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: (ego activates) The whole planet? Interesting. Chuck picks up a metal toy which he uses as a mirror to check out his reflection.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (musing)  I left my hair products on the ship... (adjusts hair) But I could improvise. Astronauts have to deal with any kind of emergency. Skiff snatches the toy from Chuck.

dialogues.speaker: SKIFF
dialogues.text: Don't contaminate the merchandise!

dialogues.speaker: ECKLE
dialogues.text: Are you sure they'll believe he's friendly? Chuck turns to Eckle with a smile.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: Sonny, I can handle the press. Not to toot my own horn, but I'm working with primo material here. Skiff steps up to Lem

dialogues.speaker: SKIFF
dialogues.text: It has horns                         Lem rolls his eyes. The mind-controlled soldiers, trying one-up each other, step up to Chuck. As each speaks, he leans in front of the other to get closer to Chuck, each trying to become Chucks favorite zombie.

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER 1
dialogues.text: Master, any orders?

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER 2
dialogues.text: Your wish is our command.

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER 1
dialogues.text: (to Soldier 2, annoyed) "Your wish is our command??". Zombies say "I hear and obey"! (to Chuck, apologizing) He's never been a zombie before. Chuck rolls his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: Uh, guys, chill out. That stops them. They look at Chuck, confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a pill. Take a number. Take a hike. They exchange a confused look. Chuck points to the next room.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Go to your room. Chuck sees Lem is forlorn.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to all but Lem) In fact, all of you, out. We need a minute. Chuck shoos everyone into the next room and closes the do so he can be alone with Lem.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Kid, what's bugging you?

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: Neera.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: What is that, like an alien hernia.

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: She's my girlfriend! Or, she was. Now she hates me.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: Hate's a strong word. (encouraging) Maybe it's just dislike...

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: Plus there's another guy. Glar.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: You know your problem? It's not Glar. Or Neera. It's Lem. Look at you, you're so left brain. Or is it right brain? Whatever, you're like the chief of control. You gotta loosen up. Lem nods. Chuck checks his readout, decides:

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We got a little time. This is your lucky day. The doctor is in!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuck puts on a record - romantic music. To Lem's surpris he dims the light.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: Why do chicks dig me? 'Cause I'm handsome? ‘Cause I'm an astronaut? Yes - and yes. But it's also because of Chuck Baker's three rules of romance: Playacting, Chuck slinks up to Lem, a hound on the prowl.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Spot your prey. Make your move. Show no mercy! (as if Lem's a woman) Hey baby, I saw you across the bar. Are sparks flying or is this place on fire? Chuck gives Lem his million dollar smile. Lem is horrifie

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now you be this chick, Neera, and I'll be you. Before Lem can protest, Chuck grabs him for a close dance

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Neera, tomorrow I go to space, perhaps never to return. Let's make my last night on earth - sorry, Planet One - a night we'll remember! Chuck dips Lem. Suddenly, the door opens. It's Skiff.

dialogues.speaker: SKIFF
dialogues.text: These guys are driving me... (sees them, shouts) Watch out for your anus!!!! WHAM! Skiff beams Chuck with a nearby Sci-fi prop.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: Owwwwwoocoooccowwww! Chuck reels. The others rush in. Lem snatches the prop a helps Chuck sit down.

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: Skiff!

dialogues.speaker: SKIFF
dialogues.text: I thought... The probe.

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: No Skiff, no anal probe! No mind control!

dialogues.speaker: SKIFF
dialogues.text: (weakly) Harvesting body parts? Chuck GROANS.

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER 1
dialogues.text: Master should we kill him? Horrified, Skiff looks at Chuck. Chuck looks back at him.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: I'm thinking... Lem pulls Skiff aside.

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: Skiff... I gotta go find that TV reporter. I need your help to keep things under control.

dialogues.speaker: SKIFF
dialogues.text: (lights up) Are you putting me in charge?

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: (lies, improvising) Yes. You're in charge... of not hitting anyone on the head and not getting caught. Can you do that? Skiff salutes enthusiastically. Lem salutes back.

dialogues.speaker: LEM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to all) No one can know we're in here, okay? (to Chuck) I'll be back with the reporter.  Lem heads out. cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bowlers from the night before lined up as soldiers examin the place for evidence. One BOWLER sees Grawl nearby.

dialogues.speaker: BOWLER
dialogues.text: We've been here all night. We want to go home!

dialogues.speaker: GRAWL
dialogues.text: Interesting. Could that be because you're an alien zombie?

dialogues.speaker: BOWLER
dialogues.text: Uhm, I guess we can stay.

dialogues.speaker: GRAWL
dialogues.text: Interesting. Could that be so we won't know you're an alien zombie?! The poor Bowler doesn't know what to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE TV REPORTER and his crew. Nothing to do.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERAMAN
dialogues.text: This is boring.

dialogues.speaker: TV REPORTER
dialogues.text: Like they say, no news - is time for lunch. They crew nods and gets in the truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lem walks along the main street. Suddenly, the TV truck drives past him. Turning to see it, Lem notices Neera, Gl and the teens outside TOWN HALL. He considers going after the truck, but has to talk to Neera. ANGLE ON THE TEENS. They stand around aimlessly. Some ca small signs that say things like"We protest!" and "Darn!"

dialogues.speaker: TEEN 1
dialogues.text: What happens now?

dialogues.speaker: NEERA
dialogues.text: Maybe we should shout something. Glar considers, then takes a step forward to shout:

dialogues.speaker: GLAR
dialogues.text: We're really upset! The teens nod approvingly, though it's not quite what Nee had in mind. Lem approaches them.

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: Neera... She turns away, indignant.

dialogues.speaker: LEM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I need to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: NEERA
dialogues.text: Shouldn't you be off killing the alien?

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: I'm not trying to kill him! I'm trying to...

dialogues.speaker: NEERA
dialogues.text: What? Lem looks at Glar and the others, realizing:

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: I can't tell you.

dialogues.speaker: NEERA
dialogues.text: Lem, I always thought we'd be together, but I'm starting to feel like I need someone who doesn't think inside a little box. Like Glar says, the times, they are a diff-er-ent. Maybe you should go. Lem goes for broke, trying Chuck's advice. He starts to like a guy on the prowl, but on him it seems jerky and weird.

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: Neera... Is this place on fire or is it just hot in here?

dialogues.speaker: NEERA
dialogues.text: What? He tries dipping her, but doesn't know how and winds up dipping himself and falling flat on the ground. Glar steps up and puts an arm around Neera, both standing over Lem.

dialogues.speaker: GLAR
dialogues.text: Is this guy giving you bad vibrations?

dialogues.speaker: NEERA
dialogues.text: (a bit sad) Lem was just leaving. They talk away, leaving Lem on the ground. cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shades are drawn. Nearby, the TV truck has just parked. The TV reporter and crew get out when they hear a CRASH from inside the comic book store. They turn and see: Something has smacked against the inside of the front doo moving the blind aside, enabling them to see: It was Rove With the blind momentarily open, they see Rover pick up a ball and head back in, the blind closing behind him. The TV reporter exchanges a look with his cameraman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEAL Skiff and Rover are playing fetch. Rover drops the ball at his feet. Skiff gets the ball and pets him.

dialogues.speaker: SKIFF
dialogues.text: Good boy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuck paces and checks his readout - the clock is ticking Eckle and the mind-controlled soldiers are with him.

dialogues.speaker: ECKLE
dialogues.text: What're you gonna say in the interview? That stops Chuck's pacing.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: I dunno. "I come in peace." Boilerplate stuff.

dialogues.speaker: ECKLE
dialogues.text: That seems kind of thin.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know... Chuck gets into character and then starts to act out the following as if he was reciting Shakespeare.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: "Space, the final frontier. These are the voyages of Captain Chuck Baker. His mission: To boldly go where no man has gone before!!!!!" The others CHEER. Chuck raises an eyebrow proudly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cameraman has set up the camera pointing inside throu a gap in the blind. THROUGH HIS POV we are able to see Chuck in the back room The sound guy quietly sticks his microphone through a sma opening in the window. Below them, Skiff and Rover play around on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuck is like an actor, dying for more applause.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: There's more where that came from!  He turns away to get into character, then turns back ominously. He's doing Darth Vadar.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: "You're a rebel spy and a traitor to the empire!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TV Reporter and Cameraman exchange a look. cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lem trudges along. At a TV store he notices people starin at a TV in the window. To his horror, Lem sees on TV: Chuck, doing his Darth Vadar. Flanked by movie monster cu outs in the store, he seems to be part of some terrifying alien army.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: "Soon we will crush the rebel alliance and control the galaxy!" Lem GASPS in horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eckle the mind-controlled soldiers are CHEERING Chuck who gestures for Eckle to come over. He puts Eckle in a fake head-lock.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: Do you hear that, Mr. Anderson? cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eckle's Mom and Dad watch Chuck on TV in horror as he doe Mr. Smith from "The Matrix".

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: That is the sound of your death. Eckle's parents GASP, horrified.  cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The attendant and a customer watch CHUCK ON TV in horror.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: (as Rod Serling) You're going on a journey, not just of sight and sound, but of mind. Your next stop: The Twilight Zone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lem runs by.

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: Skifflii!! cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lem's Dad and Mom stare at the TV in shock. Chuck has fou an alien pair of sunglasses and puts them on.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: (as Arnold) I am the terminator. You are terminated! Hasta la vista, baby!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grawl and Kipple are examining a piece of Rover that was shot off. NEARBY, the Captain stares at the TV. He calls:

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: General... Grawl and Kipple turn to the TV and see Chuck. He's doing the "Ah-nold" strongman pose.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: Ahhhggghhhh! Ahhhggghhh! Kipple examines the TV image more closely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: General, over there. Aren't those comic books? They exchange a look.

dialogues.speaker: GRAWL
dialogues.text: Captain, mobilize the army!!! cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lem bursts in.

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: We gotta get outta here now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The army arrives in jeeps and on foot, ready for action. They burst into the comic book store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lem and gang are in the jeep, minus the soldiers. Lem put Eckle out.

dialogues.speaker: ECKLE
dialogues.text: But...

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: Out! Lem floors it just as soldiers burst through the back doo Eckle hides behind some garbage cans. Lem drives them away. Soldiers quickly gather up and go after them. Skiff and Rover stay low in the backseat next Chuck's spacesuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief Gorloc steps up to the protesters.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF GORLOC
dialogues.text: You kids need to break it up.

dialogues.speaker: GLAR
dialogues.text: Why should we -- Fuzz. (off Gorloc's questioning look) There's fuzz on you. Glar picks some lint off Gorloc's uniform.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF GORLOC
dialogues.text: Assembling without a permit is against the law.

dialogues.speaker: NEERA
dialogues.text: So what?

dialogues.speaker: GLAR
dialogues.text: Against the law?! I didn't know that!! Sorry, sir. Won't happen again, sir!

dialogues.speaker: NEERA
dialogues.text: Glar...! Neera is surprised to see him being such a weenie. Suddenly, SOUND of GUNFIRE. They turn to see the soldiers chasing Lem and Chuck in the jeep. ON NEERA, shocked.

dialogues.speaker: NEERA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She can't believe it. ON LEM as he drives past, meeting eyes with Chief Gorloc is shocked. Lem is horrified. As Lem drives on, he bemoans:

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: Now I'm a wanted criminal! Perfect!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gorloc. Lem turns a corner and stops suddenly. The road ahead is blocked. They all pile out of the jeep.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: We'd better run! Lem and Chuck run off. Skiff and Rover are about to foll but more soldiers show up. They hide behind a huge digger the soldiers run by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is filled with soldiers. Grawl and Kipple enter They're led to the mind-controlled soldiers, under guard, lazily reading comic books.

dialogues.speaker: GRAWL
dialogues.text: You men, I order you to stop being zombies!

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER 1
dialogues.text: Sorry, General, I think that's against the rules.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR KIPPLE
dialogues.text: Amazing! The alien's brain is so enormous it's controlling them even now. (to mind-controlled soldiers) What's it telling you to do?

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER 1
dialogues.text: Uhm, I think I'm supposed to dig a hive for the alien queen.

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER 2
dialogues.text: (improvising) Yeah, and I'm supposed to lure more recruits. (to Soldier 1) Unless you need help with the hive.

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER 1
dialogues.text: I'm good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soldiers burst in. UP FRONT, Lem and Chuck run along the screen. People see Chuck and SCREAM. ON Chuck, assuming they're screaming at the movie. He loo up, sees a scary B&W alien monster and screams himself. L pulls him along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skiff pokes his head out to see more soldiers. Rover sidl up to the digger, supplicating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chased by soldiers, Lem and Chuck run down an alley. They find an unlocked door and slip inside to find...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a ladies tea party in progress. As soon as Chuck Lem enter, the party stops dead. They all stare at Chuck. pause.

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: What now?

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: Let the Doctor handle this. Chuck turns to the ladies and turns on the charm.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ladies... Who'd like to meet an astronaut? Suddenly, the women start screaming. Some throw things at Chuck. He starts to run away. Around each corner, more wo are there to pelt him with food. It could be right out of "Planet of the Apes". Finally, Lem is at the front door and calls:

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: Chuck! Chuck! Chuck sees Lem and heads over, through the barrage. Final the two run out to find....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .+. They're completely surrounded by soldiers. There's no escape. ANGLE ON ROVER by the digger, realizing Chuck is in troub He races over.

dialogues.speaker: SKIFF
dialogues.text: Rover....! Skiff hangs back. Rover comes up behind the soldiers, rol up atop a truck and raises all his instruments to look hi most menacing. It works. A soldier points:

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER 3
dialogues.text: Look out! The monster! Others turn and take over. Some shots are fired. ON SKIFF, horrified:

dialogues.speaker: SKIFF
dialogues.text: Rover..... 2 ON LEM AND Chuck, concerned about Rover, but knowing this their chance. They turn and run. Their jeep is now in the clear. They get in and drive off

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driving through a residential area, they look ahead and s ECKLE'S HOUSE and Chuck's ship. Very few soldiers are on guard. Lem and Chuck exchange a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The soldiers don't notice the two figures sneaking around behind the vehicles. Finally, Lem and Chuck make their way unseen under the sh Chuck carries his spacesuit.

dialogues.speaker: THE SHIP
dialogues.text: Now Chuck can work freely. He presses some buttons and a combination to unlock the bottom latch. HISSSSS as the latch opens. This is it. Chuck is gonna ma it. He looks at Lem and they smile. Chuck starts to reach for the ladder when suddenly.... THE SHIP STARTS TO RISE, as if taking off. Chuck can't believe his eyes. Who's piloting his ship WIDER ANGLE REVEALS the ship is being lifted by a crane be loaded onto a large army truck. As it's lifted, Lem an Chuck are left exposed underneath. The half dozen soldiers stare frozen.

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: (aside to Chuck) Any ideas? Suddenly Chuck grabs hold of the American flag he planted and waves it maniacally.

dialogues.speaker: NEARBY SOLDIER
dialogues.text: He's got the doomsday device! Chuck looks at the flag. Okay, whatever.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: Right, and I'm not afraid to use itl! Chuck throws the flag way up in the air like a spear. All the soldiers SCREAM and dive for cover. Chuck grabs Lem a they run for a neighbor's car nearby. They climb in.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Quick, hot-wire the car!!

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: What's that? Chuck rolls his eyes and starts to do it himself.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: When are you people going to evolve?! Chuck hotwires the car. They take off as the frightened soldiers come out of hiding. WIDE OF SUBURBIA as Chuck and Lem drive off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rover is led away by soldiers. From a distance, Skiff watches, despondent. Eckle joins him.

dialogues.speaker: SKIFF
dialogues.text: Why did he do it? He had his whole life ahead of him! With Skiff looking down, only Eckle notices the car with and Chuck driving off towards the planetarium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment out of "ET": Soldiers in germ-proof suits approa the store with a giant plastic roll. Others seal the stor in plastic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rover and the two mind-controlled soldiers are under guar Rover looks worse for having been shot up. Into the air-tight seal of the front door comes General Grawl. Then, right behind him comes Kipple, smiling, rari for action. Rover is freaking. EXT. TOWN HALL — CONTINUOUS ON THE TV REPORTER, speaking to camera. Behind him, Chuck ship is taken away in a convoy.

dialogues.speaker: TV REPORTER
dialogues.text: The flying saucer is going to an undisclosed location to be taken apart and studied. (gets message on earpiece) Correction: I'm told it will be studied, then taken apart and then studied again. cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lem and Chuck stand on the balcony. In the distance, they see Chuck's ship being carted off. Chuck checks his DIGITAL READOUT. Just about 1 day left.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: Great! Perfect! Now I'll never get home! John Glenn goes around the  world - he's a Senator for life! I went across the freakin' universe! I should be Governor, minimum! But no, I'm stuck on this stupid rock! Chuck storms inside. Lem follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lem closes shades and locks the place for the night.

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: This "stupid rock" is my home. Or it was 'till you came along and RUINED EVERYTHING! I want my life back!!! Unless there's something else you want to ruin! Suddenly, Lem walks headlong into the Curator. A pause.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: Who's that?

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: (flat) My boss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lem gently puts the Curator inside the closet.

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: Sorry, Mr. Hucklo, it's just for one night. Maybe a week. (forces a smile) I hope this won't affect our working relationship. Lem closes the door. From inside, a gentle KNOCK. Lem ope the door.

dialogues.speaker: CURATOR
dialogues.text: (simply) You're fired. Lem nods - he knew it. He closes the door and locks it. Suddenly, from outside, SOUND of a car screeching to a st Lem and Chuck exchange a worried look. cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kipple examines the mind-controlled soldiers like a norma doctor, looking inside their antenna like they were ears.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR KIPPLE
dialogues.text: I should very much like to get inside your heads.

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER 2
dialogues.text: Well, I have a lot of unresolved feelings about my childhood...

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR KIPPLE
dialogues.text: No, I mean surgically. Kipple reveals his scary looking surgical instruments. Grawl steps up.

dialogues.speaker: GRAWL
dialogues.text: Never mind them, Professor. (re: Rover) This thing has the answers! Grawl looms over Rover who quivers in fear and wets himse

dialogues.speaker: GRAWL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You found your master before. Well you can find him again! Where's the alien?                        ! Talk!! Talkitit! Grawl bangs Rover, causing a mechanical whirring, followe by a light beam shooting out and projecting a holographic image. The image shows WILLIAM SHATNER and LEONARD NIMOY in thei "Star Trek" costumes.

dialogues.speaker: SHATNER
dialogues.text: Hi, I'm William Shatner.

dialogues.speaker: NIMOY
dialogues.text: And I'm Leonard Nimoy. Grawl and Kipple stare in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: SHATNER
dialogues.text: We've been asked by NASA and Paramount Studios to send our greetings.

dialogues.speaker: NIMOY
dialogues.text: By now you've met our Pathfinder, Rover. Its mission is simple...

dialogues.speaker: SHATNER
dialogues.text: ...-To explore new worlds. To seek out new life and new civilizations.

dialogues.speaker: NIMOY
dialogues.text: (with a nod to Shatner) That is, after all, only logical.

dialogues.speaker: SHATNER
dialogues.text: So on behalf of the people of planet earth...

dialogues.speaker: NIMOY
dialogues.text: .».-May you live long and prosper. Nimoy holds up the Vulcan split-fingers sign. Shatner tri for that, but has to force his fingers apart with his oth hand.

dialogues.speaker: SHATNER
dialogues.text: I can never get that... The image zitzes off. Grawl and Kipple stare blankly. cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lem and Chuck stand on either side of the door. It's fair dark inside, so they can see the silhouettes of two omino figures entering. As they do, Lem and Chuck pounce. There's a SCUFFLE. Hard to tell who's winning. Suddenly the lights go on. It's Skiff and Eckle.

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: ECKLE
dialogues.text: We came to help! All of us. Eckle turns to the door. Neera enters. She stares at Chuc in wonder.

dialogues.speaker: NEERA
dialogues.text: You're the alien!

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: You are, but let's not get into that. Neera turns to Lem.

dialogues.speaker: NEERA
dialogues.text: You've been helping him? Lem simply nods. Neera's grin shows she approves. She tur to Chuck.

dialogues.speaker: NEERA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm Neera. I'm honored to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: Now that's how you greet an astronaut. (to Neera) Captain Chuck Baker, ma'am, at your service. Chuck takes her hand and kisses it. Neera blushes.

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: Great! Just great! First it's Glar. Now it's Chuck! Perfect! Lem storms off into the main auditorium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuck enters. Lem is staring up at the stars above. Chuck steps up. A pause.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: No response. So Chuck sits down next to Lem. A pause. Lem keeps looking up at the stars, so Chuck takes a new tact. looks up and points.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That's my home up there. (points) See that star, the little red one? Circling that star is a planet called earth - about 20 billion miles away, give or take.

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: Lem looks There's a Lem turns (mind-blown) Space is that big?

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: You kidding? There's billions of galaxies out there. And each of them has billions of stars. Next to that our worlds are just grains of sand.

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: (laments ) Nothing I knew was right.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: You knew about Neera. She's a great chick. And she loves you, I can tell.

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: I don't have the right stuff like you.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: (confesses) Kid... I never had the right stuff. I'm a button pusher. Spam in a can. I don't even fly the ship, I just push the buttons when they tell me to. I only got this job 'cause of my rugged good looks. You're the one with the right stuff. You risked everything to help a stranger from another world. Neera would be lucky to have a guy like you. at Chuck, moved, eyes welling up. gentle knock. The others tentatively enter.

dialogues.speaker: NEERA
dialogues.text: Lem...? to her. Neither knows what to say. Eckle breaks the silence.

dialogues.speaker: ECKLE
dialogues.text: What do we do now? Good question. No one seems to know, except Lem. He rises growing the beginning of a true spine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to get Chuck to his ship.

dialogues.speaker: ECKLE
dialogues.text: But where is it?

dialogues.speaker: SKIFF
dialogues.text: Base 9! I told you it's real!

dialogues.speaker: NEERA
dialogues.text: But we don't know where it is. Chuck realizes:

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: Yes we do! Rover found me.... I can program him to find my ship! (less sure) At least, if I find the instructions.

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: (looks around) Where IS Rover? Skiff starts to weep melodramatically.

dialogues.speaker: SKIFF
dialogues.text: It's too painful to talk about! Eckle gives him a consoling pat on the back.

dialogues.speaker: ECKLE
dialogues.text: They've got him at the comic book shop!

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: Then we've gotta go get him! Neera's amazed by this new Lem, but she holds out a hand.

dialogues.speaker: NEERA
dialogues.text: Hold on. The whole army's looking for you two! You can't just stroll through town. MOVE IN ON LEM as he realizes:

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: (to Eckle and Skiff) That new movie opens tonight, right?  Skiff and Eckle exchange a look.

dialogues.speaker: ECKLE
dialogues.text: Yeah, why? Lem smiles. cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A walking scene, SLOW MOTION to music like in "The Right Stuff". Our characters seem mighty. After Chuck we see th alien costumes on Lem, Skiff, Eckle and Neera. With dangl extra arms, cardboard teeth, eyes on springs, the costume are a weird contrast to the mightiness of the moment. Chuck gives Lem a slow motion thumbs up. Lem returns it. Then, as things go to normal speed, Lem turns to Skiff:

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: You sure no one can see my face?

dialogues.speaker: SKIFF
dialogues.text: The police'll never recognize you.

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: (embarrassed) I'm more worried about my friends. REVEAL around them, a number of locals in alien costumes, walking towards:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We start on a huge poster for "Humaniacs 3" filled with images of invading aliens. REVEAL A SIGN for the costume contest as dozens gather in makeshift alien costumes. Most costumes are pretty awful versions of the aliens on the movie poster - many human- like. The event has the feeling of a "Star Wars" opening. WE FIND THE TV REPORTER, speaking to his TV camera.

dialogues.speaker: TV REPORTER
dialogues.text: Here at ground zero, undaunted by by hordes of invading aliens, the residents of Glipforg bravely go about their normal routines.  ON THE TEACHER atop a makeshift stage, announcing:

dialogues.speaker: TEACHER
dialogues.text: Humaniacs to my left! Machiniacs to my right! Fleshivores and brain eaters in the middle!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With Kipple and Grawl busy, Rover sees there's a clear pa to the front door. And the door is open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From where they stand, Lem and Chuck can see the comic bo shop in the distance. They exchange a look. About to head over, they each have hand placed on their shoulders. Have they been caught? REVEAL it's the Teacher.

dialogues.speaker: TEACHER
dialogues.text: What great costumes! You two are finalists. (points to makeshift stage) Up on stage!

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: We're not here to enter the contest.

dialogues.speaker: TEACHER
dialogues.text: Then why are you dressed like aliens? That draws the attention of some soldiers nearby who look Chuck suspiciously. Lem looks around and sees there's soldiers everywhere. He turns back to the Teacher.

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: We're here to WIN the contest! Let's go! Lem puts an arm around Chuck who offers a thumbs up. With desperate look back at Neera, Lem and Chuck follow the teacher up on stage. There's so many soldiers around, the can't run off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rover looks around. No one's watching him. Working up the nerve, he bolts for the door. Suddenly, a Soldier sees him and readies his rifle. Befor he fires, a hand reaches out to stop him. It's Grawl.

dialogues.speaker: GRAWL
dialogues.text: Hold your fire.

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER 4
dialogues.text: But General, it's getting away. MOVE IN ON GRAWL who mutters softly to Rover:

dialogues.speaker: GRAWL
dialogues.text: Take us to your leader...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON ROVER, his tracking light blinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON CHUCK AND LEM, now on stage, looking around for a way get out of there. There are soldiers on either side of th stage. Chuck doesn't see his tracking device starts blinking. ON THE TEACHER, stepping up to the microphone. She taps i

dialogues.speaker: TEACHER
dialogues.text: Welcome to the "Humaniacs 3" costume contest! Let's hear it for the finalists! People start CHEERING. Among the crowd, Lem's parents, surprised to see him there. Lem leans in to whisper:

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: What do we do? Chuck lifts his helmet just slightly. Eyeing the crowd, h grows a sly smile.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: I say, let's give ‘em their daily minimum dose of Chuck. He lowers his helmet and turns to the crowd, waving, pla it up. They love it and CHEER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rover rolls along. Sensing something, he stops and looks around. Nothing's there. As he rolls on, we REVEAL he's being tailed by soldiers. Up ahead: The movie theater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lem watches as fellow contestants parade for the cheering crowd. Then, to his shock, Chuck floats by him doing the "Moonwalk". The crowd loves it. Chuck waves. Lem looks out and exchanges a worried look with Neera. ON Chuck, doing more showboating. He motions for Lem to c join him. Lem shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: General Grawl, Kipple and soldiers are stalking Rover. He rolls on, oblivious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuck is doing the twist a la Travolta in "Pulp Fiction". People cheer. Chuck pulls Lem over and makes him dance too. ON LEM. He can't believe this. But as he reluctantly goes along, the crowd cheers more. What the hell, Lem does a little dance move. The crowd lo it. Lem smiles, having fun. He waves to Neera who stands with Skiff and Eckle. She looks around nervously, then starts smile, especially when she sees Lem on stage showboating. Chuck falls to the floor and does some hip-hop spins. Lem falls to the floor and joins him.  The crowd loves it. ANGLE ON ROVER, approaching the rear of the crowd. REVEAL BEHIND HIM: Soldiers approach. ANGLE ON STAGE. Chuck and Lem jump to their feet and hold their arms for the cheering crowd. The Teacher steps back up to the microphone.

dialogues.speaker: TEACHER
dialogues.text: I think we have a winner! Make that twol! The teacher gestures to Chuck and Lem and hands them a trophy. They each grab hold with one hand and raise it up the air. People cheer. Lem is thrilled. ANGLE ON ROVER in the crowd, using his 'arms' to clap. He looks to his side where Lem's parents stand. Lem's Mom an Rover share a "smile". Then, she suddenly realizes what she's smiling at and:

dialogues.speaker: SCREAMS
dialogues.text: People now sees Rover and start to SCREAM and run. The soldiers close in. On stage, Lem and Chuck realize they're in danger. They l around for a way to get out of there. It's pandemonium. People screaming. Running. Soldiers grabbing people in alien costumes, ripping off masks to f Chuck. Neera and Eckle waving to Lem, pointing where to r Lem and Chuck see a clear way to escape from there. They walk casually, playing it cool. Rover looks around in a panic. He turns to run, but sudde finds himself facing General Grawl. Instantly, Rover is surrounded by soldiers who capture him. The Captain comes up to Grawl.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: All these costumes, sir. How do we find the alien? Grawl looks around and spots something. He grins knowingl

dialogues.speaker: GRAWL
dialogues.text: It's simple, Captain. The alien, like us, is in uniform. REVEAL Grawl is looking at Chuck and Lem. ANGLE ON CHUCK, featuring the American Flag patch on his shoulder. Chuck and Lem are about to get away when suddenly a flood soldiers surround them, rifles drawn. It's over. ANGLE ON ROVER, placed into a dog carrier, a prisoner. ANGLE ON SKIFF, watching this. He feels bad for Rover, bu then notices a discarded alien costume that looks somewha like Rover. He gets an idea. Grawl steps up to Chuck and Lem. Grawl and Chuck stand fa to face for the first time. Chuck starts to take off his helmet. A tense moment for everyone there. Then, his face is revealed. Some people GASP. But Chuck doesn't flinch and keeps looking at them all. A nervous moment. Kipple steps up and joins Grawl.

dialogues.speaker: GRAWL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Look at it, Professor. It's disgusting. And it smells!

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: (defensive) You try wearing the same suit for three weeks and see how you smell! Kipple steps up and examines Chuck's skull.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR KIPPLE
dialogues.text: Amazing! A brain even larger than mine! (points to Chuck's skull) An incision here. And here. The brain should pop right out. Chuck is horrified, as are Lem and friends. Even Grawl is grossed out.

dialogues.speaker: GRAWL
dialogues.text: Why the brain, Professor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because the brain is the key to everything.

dialogues.speaker: SKIFF
dialogues.text: Not the anus?? Lem steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: You're making a mistake! He's friendly! Kipple turns to Lem.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR KIPPLE
dialogues.text: Poor boy. He's a zombie. I'll remove his brain too. Lem's face drops as soldiers grab him. Neera is horrified Lem's Mom cries. ON Chuck, seeing all this, then looking at Lem. He's got do something. Suddenly Chuck breaks free of the guards and begins to ma that sci-fi SOUND again.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: Hmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmm ! t!! People step back, scared. He steps up to Lem, holding out his arms in that monster- like way. He makes weird alien hypnotic motions. And his voice sounds monotone and alien-like.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You-are-no-longer-needed-slave! I- release-you! Return-to-your-puny- life! Chuck puts his hands on Lem's head as if to squeeze his brain. Aside, so no one else can hear, Chuck tells him:

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm going down anyway, kid, no need for you to go with me. Thanks for everything. Now Chuck gets dramatic, making a mind-releasing gesture a final sci-fi SOUND. It's over and everyone buys into it. Lem's parents run u and embrace him. Lem is too shocked by events to respond.

dialogues.speaker: LEM'S MOM
dialogues.text: Lem! Chuck heads back to where he was standing before.

dialogues.speaker: GRAWL
dialogues.text: How about it, Professor? Kipple steps up to Lem and looks him over.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR KIPPLE
dialogues.text: Difficult to tell. (to Lem) Do you still believe the alien is friendly? A pause. Lem looks around. His parents look at him hopefully. Neera shakes her head. Skiff motions for Lem t say no. Chuck offers a smile and shakes his head. Finally Lem looks down.

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR KIPPLE
dialogues.text: This boy is free! Cheers and sighs of relief.

dialogues.speaker: GRAWL
dialogues.text: All right. Let's get these aliens to Base 9. Chuck is taken away with a sad look of "good-bye" to Lem. Lem is near tears. Chuck is shoved roughly into a truck. The other soldiers quickly load the dog carrier. Grawl gets into a nearby je People gather around Lem, further separating him from Chu PULL BACK to show Lem helplessly surrounded and embraced the crowd as Chuck is taken away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A low, musical intro to a SONG begins.  A convoy of army vehicles drives by. ON ONE VEHICLE, a truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a huge truck. Chuck is behind bars, in a cell in center of the truck. He's guarded by soldiers nearby. The dog carrier is lashed to a truck panel. Chuck looks down at the DIGITAL READOUT. Now he has less than a day left. As the intro ends and the SONG BEGINS, Chuck is the one who sings: "Space Oddity". Chuck belts i out dramatically and with lots of self-pity:

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: (singing) Ground control to Major Tom. (as background) 10. 9. 8. (singing) Commencing countdown engines on. (as background) 5. 4. (singing) Check ignition and may God's love be with you..... (as background) Liftoff. As the music kicks in, we use this song to intercut betwe Lem and Chuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lem and his family approach their home through a throng o reporters and bystanders. The reporters take pictures of Lem. What should be a proud moment, is sad for him. ANGLE ON NEERA, going into her home next door. She looks Lem sadly. Eckle is with her. The song continues, sung by Chuck.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (sings) This is ground control to Major Tom. You really made the grade. (reporters take pictures of Lem)  And the papers want to know whose shirts you wear. (on Neera, watching Lem sadly) Now it's time to leave the capsule if you dare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck has arrived. Soldiers come and take Chuck out o his cell as he keeps singing self-righteously. The truck parked at the BASE 9 containment building. The soldiers literally LIFT CHUCK IN THE AIR and carry hi inside. They also take Rover's cage.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: (singing) This is Major Tom to ground control. I'm stepping through the door. And I'm floating in a most peculiar way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuck is tossed inside his cell. He looks around his new prison cell.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: (singing) And the world looks very different today!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON LEM, looking around at the stars, seemingly surrounded them as CAMERA 'FLOATS' around him.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (sings) For here am I floating in a tin can. REVEAL Lem is at his domed roof, looking at the night sky we see him from an extreme HIGH ANGLE.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (sings) Far above the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Chuck from that same HIGH ANGLE as he looks up, seemingly at the distant stars and earth.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: (singing) Planet earth is blue and there's nothing I can do. REVERSE shows him in his new cell. Chuck starts to do his "BOWIE CLAP" in that affected, effeminate way. The guards nearby watch him, weirded out. On the SECOND CLAP we abruptly... cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hands clapping in a MATCH CUT. This starts applause for.. THE TV REPORTER, getting ready to conduct a live intervie

dialogues.speaker: TV REPORTER
dialogues.text: We're here to honor a young man who survived a harrowing ordeal at the hands of the alien monster. Lem, come on out! People applaud. Among those in the audience, Neera, Eckle Skiff, Eckle's parents, Chief Gorloc, the Milkman, the Mailman, the Teacher, the Curator. ANGLE ON LEM AND HIS PARENTS, standing in the wings. Lem seems trance-like.

dialogues.speaker: LEM'S DAD
dialogues.text: Son? His parents exchange a bewildered look.

dialogues.speaker: LEM'S MOM
dialogues.text: You did it. You got everything you always wanted.

dialogues.speaker: LEM'S DAD
dialogues.text: Isn't that great? Lem nods and glumly goes out to the center. He sits by th TV Reporter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lem, I understand you'll be working right here after you graduate, teaching about the mysteries of space. Give us a preview. Lem looks around, uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: Well... (recalls by rote) If you were to stretch a rope from one end of the universe to the other, it would reach over 500 miles!

dialogues.speaker: TV REPORTER
dialogues.text: 500 miles! Impressed reaction from the audience.

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: (still by rote) And have you ever tried counting the stars? Don't bother, there's too many. Over one thousand.

dialogues.speaker: TV REPORTER
dialogues.text: One thousand! Remarkable. More of a reaction from the audience. That starts to snap Lem out of it. He looks around at them, starting to reali something.

dialogues.speaker: LEM
dialogues.text: You know what's really remarkable? That we believe this. No one knows how big space is. There's billions of galaxies and each one of them has billions of stars. Next to that, our world is just... Lem stops and looks around, coming fully back to life.

dialogues.speaker: LEM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Excuse me. Lem walks away. Neera and Eckle exchange a look. She nods Skiff who takes off one way. She and Eckle go the other. The reporter urgently motions to someone who flips a swit that starts a typical 50's singing commercial.  cur TO:
